citation.article-title: Assignment of Actinomyces pyogenes-like (CDC coryneform group E) bacteria to the genus Actinomyces as Actinomyces radingae sp. nov. and Actinomyces turicensis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Actinomyces turicensis sp. nov.
Actinomyces turicensis (relating to Turicum, the Roman name for Zurich, Switzerland)
The following description is based on a study of two strains (Wust et al. 1993).
Cells consist of straight and slightly curved rods with some branching (approximately 0.5-0.8 μm diameter x 2-3 μm); part of the cells show slight clubbing.
Most cells stain Gram-positive with some irregularities giving a beaded appearance.
Growth on sheep blood agar is equal under aerobic conditions with 5% CO2 and anaerobically.
Colonies on sheep blood agar are whitish to greyish, slightly dull, circular, low convex of about 0-3-0.5 mm diameter after 48-h incubation aerobically with 5 % CO2.
Haemolysis under aerobic conditions mostly weak; in one strain, haemolysis could not be detected.
Haemolysis is absent anaerobically.
Catalase-negative.
Acid is produced from glucose, maltose, ribose, sucrose and xylose.
Triple sugar iron agar is acidified in both slant and butt.
Acid is not produced from amygdalin, glycogen, rhamnose and sorbitol.
Some strains produce acid from arabinose, cellobiose, erythritol, fructose, galactose, inositol, lactose, mannitol, mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, salicin and trehalose.
C4 and C8 esterases, leucin arylamidase and pyrazinamidase are mostly positive.
Alkaline phosphatase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, β-glucuronidase, lipase, cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, phosphohydrolase, α-mannosidase and pyrrolidonyl arylamidase are negative.
Aesculin is hydrolysed slowly by one strain only.
Urea and gleatin are not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The main metabolic fatty acids are succinic and lactic acids.

The main cellular fatty acids when grown in PRAS peptone yeast glucose medium with Tween 80 are 10:0 (3-6%), 14:0 (2-6), 16:1cis9 (6-10), 16:0 (9-13), 18:1cis9 (44-61), feature 10 (18:1C11/T9/T6 or un-17.834 equivalent chain length fatty acid) (7-11).
DNA base composition is 57.5 mol% G + C (Tm).
Peptidoglycan is of the L-Orn-L-Lys-D-Glu type (ASP).
Strains have mainly been isolated from mixed infections associated with anaerobes, Streptococcus 'milleri', enterococci, and Gram-negative rods.
The habitat is unknown.
The type strain (APL10) is DSM 9168T ( = CCUG 32401T).
